title: datalad mv
body:
Needed it already a few times :-/

I see interface to look as simple as 
`datalad mv [--drop] PATHs DEST`
where DEST could be a different repository/dataset.  `--drop` would (force)drop load from current repository

Simplistic outline of actions in case if DEST is in different dataset  from a PATH (in implementation should sort paths into datasets first and then work per dataset ascending in hierarchy) should do
- for PATH in PATHs
  - git annex unlock  PATH 
  - mv PATH DEST/
  - git rm PATH  # in current
  - git annex drop --force PATH # in current... I guess two above could be done via some `datalad uninstall` call?
  - git add DEST/(basename PATH)  # target
- and I guess `datalad save` in all involved repositories (source PATHs could be in different datasets I guess)
- if moving datasets
  - annex `description` for that clone should be adjusted to the new location if current value matches its original location
  - its possible superdataset's submodule's record, e.g. path (and possibly url) might also be needed to be adjusted
